content.raw:
Per discussion with @nkoenig and @spaepcke we will do this in small steps.  Potentially something like below:

 1. Control and manipulate only a single link in the entire world at a time. Disable controller when mouse [left] button is released.
 1. Persistant controller for a single link even when mouse button is released.  Activating control of a different link disables previous link controller.  Alternatively, user can manually disable an active controller by key or mouse buttons.
 1. Persistant control of multiple links simultaneously.

Some other things to think about:

 * highlight controlled links,
 * highlight controlled link target pose,
 * add panel or floating GUI menu for tuning controller PID gains and to set controller state (active/not active) for each link.
